column3:
> When you don't have an unencrypted key and you have git configured to always sign all commits, you have to sign three times instead of one.

This is strange. I have my key on a token and never had to sign more than once. Do you have something in your git config that forces signing all commits?
I guess making this explicit cannot hurt so utACK anyhow, though, we can't potentially support an

Yeah like you quoted, I have git configured to sign all commits. Yeah but it doesn't hurt to be explicit, actually the code comments say "first create unsigned commit" or something and then don't have the no-sign flag.

```toml
[commit]
	gpgsign = true
```
> Yeah like you quoted, I have git configured to sign all commits.\n\nWhoops, missed that.
